data.title: Lovely people and place
data.text: I stopped here because my daughter goes by "Mimi" so we went to take a look, and boy are we glad we did. The restaurant was beautiful, the food was AMAZING, and the workers are so kind.  We will be back!

data.title: Mimi's is a tradition with us
data.text: Mimi's never disappoints us whether it is for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Their muffins are huge! We always order a container of muffins to go when we leave because they are so tasty.  A wide variety of mostly American food in a French Bistro atmosphere.

data.title: Excellent lunch!
data.text: Excellent lunch choice. Everyone at our table had fantastic food. The buttermilk spice muffin was heavenly, all the entrees were delicious, and you can't go wrong on the dessert menu. The mousse in the chocolate-based pie was perhaps the best I've ever had. Wish I lived closer!!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: I totally love the food in this restaurant. Stayed in Costa Mesa a week and ate here every chance I got. Can't go wrong with anything here. Great portions too. Standard meal 10.00

data.title: Always good
data.text: Mimi's may tend toward the French side of meals, but I find they have comfort foods that never fail to satisfy.

data.title: A Nice Quiet Atmosphere
data.text: The service was slow, however, when they did come they were wonderfully friendly!  Our food was very good.  I had the chicken Caesar and my companion had the Half Chicken and fries.  I loved my salad and would go back again.  I have a restricted diet and I love it when I find something I can eat.  That's tasty.....

data.title: disappointing
data.text:
Every other year we go back to try again with the hope they have gotten back to where they were when they opened many years ago but we have been disappointed each and every time.

The wait staff tries but the food is not worth the visit.

There are too many other local options to waste your time here

data.title: My New Favorite Mimi's
data.text:
I've been to Mimi's before, but never this particular one in Costa Mesa.  We had a wonderful breakfast with some great wait staff.  Even the manager stopped by to see how we were doing.  I could tell he was a very hands-on kind of guy because he was constantly walking the dining areas, helping move tables and chairs as needed, talking with patrons, etc.  That tells me a lot about a restaurant when a manager is that involved in the overall dining experience.  

The food came out promptly and my Eggs Benedict with Smoked Salmon was wonderful.  My wife and daughters also enjoyed their meals.  This is now my favorite Mimi's Restaurant!  I will definitely come back here the next time I am visiting Orange County.

data.title: just went for lunch
data.text: food was good , they also have pies, its an popular place so there is a little wait but not bad waitresses were friendly and took care of business

data.title: Quick bite
data.text: Casual dining with good menu choice including some healthier options available.  We had fish and chips which was a huge portion and a quiche Lorraine with salad.  All beautiful and well presented by a friendly waitress. Good price and more than enough free soda refills.

data.title: Excelent Food for the Price
data.text: I have gone to this Mimi's twice now, once at lunch and once at dinner. The food is not  expensive and it is very good. The portion sizes are also large enough to feed even the hungriest visitor and the complementary breadbasket is bottomless at dinner (if you ask). The staff there is chill so you feel like you are talking to a real person, but it might take a while to get your water refilled.

data.title: Oui!! Oui! Oui!
data.text: Very accommodating to it's customers. You never feel rushed and your server is always attentive. Had a Christmas dinner there for 30 ladies. . . Very nice.

data.title: S-L-O-W Service. We're not coming back!!
data.text:
We have not been to Mimi's for quite some time, but read somewhere that the Mimi chain had "reinvented" themselves. So...we went for breakfast on a Saturday morning with fingers crossed.

Well, we were seated, and sat...and sat, and sat some more!! We finally got a cup of coffee and placed our orders. By the way, the menu has been completely changed and is very limited.

Then we sat some more...for 30+ minutes, waiting for a couple of simple omelets. 

It got to be so bad that we were about to walk out of there. The restaurant was only 1/3 full, and there appeared to be plenty of servers. 

I have no idea what they were doing out in the kitchen. Our "quick" breakfast took almost 2 hours from start to finish...!!! We're done with Mimi's.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Food selection and wait staff are teriffic.  We opted for the nrw speciality burgers this time and were very pleased

data.title: Nice Start to a Travel Day in Southern California.
data.text: After an evening of ocean walks and good food, a special breakfast keeps us smiling. Glad we were directed to "Mimi's", while traveling in the Newport Beach area of California. Lots of good options on their menu, including a few departures from the everyday list of breakfast offerings.  Pomme Lyonnaise Benedict would have been excellent, had the potato seen just a few more minutes on the griddle.  Mushy, it was a disappointment in texture, but the flavor was a winner.  Fresh fruit is always a welcome treat while traveling, as were the comfortable surroundings and friendly service. The busy room and subdued atmosphere attested to the good reputation of this restaurant as a dining destination for this area.

data.title: Mimi's Cafe great food n atmosphere
data.text: Mimi's is an excellent place for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Excellent selection, quality and value. It's like a gourmet Denny's!  You can have good meal and a glass of wine or beer and no breaking the bank.  The corn chowder and French onion soups are excellent. The muffins are yummy and big. Chicken fingers, burgers, sandwiches can't go wrong. Dinners are home style yet not greasy spoon.  They used to have a larger breakfast menu however from waffles to omelettes good stuff.

data.title: What A Great BREAKFAST!!!
data.text: I had the Cinnamon Brioche French Toast.  I'm normally not a French toast person when I eat out but these were awesome. I ordered Le Grand which filled out my plate with sausage and eggs. Wife ordered the delicious Pomme Lyonnaise Benedict.  Again, very tasty.  These are just a couple of the many options on the menu to turn a traditional eggs and bacon/sausage breakfast into a special treat. Most importantly, the food was better than good. So what was so good?  It is hard to excel at breakfast but Mimi's does. The food just tasted really good and far better than you might expect from your typical restaurant breakfast.

data.title: Nice food, mismatched Decor
data.text: I ordered a strawberry walnut strawberry salad. My partner had pancakes ands eggs Benedict with beyon style corn beef and potatoes. The pancakes were the best id ever eaten. Everything else was good but not excellent. The service was fast and friendly. The Decor was odd old school European mixed with French provincial. It was pricey, more so than IHOP, but it was higher quality. I'd go again.

data.title: Good food, nice ambience
data.text: Huge portions. Comfortable seating and good service. No wait. Convenient parking and close to hospital.

data.title: Tasty breakfast
data.text: A couple years ago when we came to CA we ate at Mimi's for dinner.  At this time, their menu was different and they also offered breakfast in the evening.  It was very good, so when we returned this time, we ate at Mimi's for dinner again.  The new menu for lunch/dinner has a lot to be desired.  I wasn't too thrilled with my food and the server was MIA for quite a bit of time that I gave up and just ate most of it.  We tried Mimi's again for breakfast before we left and it was very good! I had the strawberry waffles and they were some of the best I've tasted! The service at breakfast was much better than dinner, however we were there for longer than we'd planned because the kitchen was a bit slow at cooking.
